meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Just got paged by the Rootly alert. Error rate on the web tier has spiked — it's off the charts.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Yeah, I’m getting reports from CS too. Users can’t even load the homepage.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Confirmed. I tried hitting the app — getting a 502 within a couple seconds.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Is it just the web tier or is the API tier also affected? What about our analytics product?

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Looks like API is fine but analytics is down as well - let's record that both Web and Analytics are affected on the incident record please under Affected Services

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Ok all of us are busy but ya lets remember to record both of those services on the incident record.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: This is a really crazy one, do you guys have any idea whats going on? I'm not sure what to do here.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: I have a couple hunches but I'm not sure. I'm going to try to get a few more details from the logs.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: How are we only getting paged now? We've been seeing this for 10 minutes. We need a follow up to tune our monitoring and alerting

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: I managed to load it once, but latency is crazy. Like 10+ seconds on login.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Looks like this is widespread. We should treat this as a SEV-1. Current severity is SEV-2, but we should bump it up. Can someone take care of that?

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: No time now but lets remember to do this after the fact

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Are we seeing anything in Cloudflare?

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Pulling up CDN metrics now, but nothing stands out at first glance.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Cloudflare status page is all green. Doesn’t look like an edge issue.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Okay, what about traffic volume? Is this just a spike that’s overwhelming us?

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Checking that too. But traffic looks fairly typical for this hour.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: So probably not DDoS or flash crowd then.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: It could still be something in the network path — DNS maybe?

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: I ran a couple tests — DNS resolution is fine from multiple regions.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Alright, so not CDN, not DNS, not traffic. Let’s look deeper in the stack.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: App servers are showing elevated latency, but not pegged.

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Could this be backend-related? Database maybe?

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Hang on, just pulled up DB metrics. postgres database is absolutely pegged right now.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: Whoa — 100% CPU on postgres.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: That’s not good. Anyone know what’s querying it right now?

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Checking logs… seeing a ton of reads on `auth.sessions`.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Yeah, and they’re slow. Like 2–3 second execution times each.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Could this be caused by a recent deploy?

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Pulling up the deploy timeline now.

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Anyone try that new ramen place down the block? Was legit.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: What did you have for lunch yesterday? I’m starving now.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Thinking about getting tacos again. Not the healthiest, but worth it.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: I swear I blinked and it's already 2 PM. Where does the time go?

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Deploy #341 hit prod about 20 minutes ago. Owned by the auth team.

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Found the PR. It changes how session validation is done — adds a fallback path.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: That fallback path might be triggering more DB lookups than expected.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Oh yeah — looks like it's running a new query on every single page load.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Well that explains the saturation. It’s a pretty heavy join too.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: That would hit `auth.sessions` for logged-in and logged-out users, right?

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Exactly. We're doing full reads even on static pages.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: This is likely our root cause then. Should we initiate a rollback?

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: I’m in favor. We’ve ruled out the edge and this is a clear regression.

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Alright, let’s do it. Who’s got access? I'm not sure I have the right permissions.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: Okay, found the rollback playbook. It’s in Confluence, but it looks... really outdated.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Yeah, this mentions using the old deploy tool. That was deprecated months ago.

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: I’m trying the command from the doc anyway. Give me a sec...

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Nope — permission denied. Looks like I don’t have access to trigger this rollback path.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Who actually knows how to do this? Has anyone done a rollback on the new pipeline?

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Maybe Frank? He helped with the last hotfix rollout. Let me ping him.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Just joined — yeah, I can kick it off. Give me a minute to pull the commit SHA.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: I can’t believe we’re 8 minutes into a SEV-1 and we still haven’t started rollback.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Honestly wild that we don’t have a clear rollback flow documented.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: This has to go into the postmortem. We should flag the rollback playbook for urgent update.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Totally. Let’s make updating the rollback steps an action item after this.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Alright, found the SHA and kicking off rollback now.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: I’ve got it. Rolling back to previous release now.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: Rollback in progress... ETA 2–3 minutes to full propagate.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: DB CPU is still pinned but trending slightly down. Promising.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Rollback completed. Let’s see if things stabilize.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Latency graph is dipping — this looks good.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Error rate is down about 40% already.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Site is loading much faster now. I’m getting sub-1s responses.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Calling it — rollback resolved the issue.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Okay, let’s capture some learnings while it’s fresh.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: First thing: rollback took way too long to initiate.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Yeah. The runbook was outdated. I had to dig through old threads to figure it out.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: We should update the rollback runbook — make it front and center in Rootly.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s tune our latency and error alerts to be more aggressive.

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Another one — this should’ve been caught in staging.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Do we even have tests for that fallback session path?

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Not really. It was an edge case and it slipped through.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: We need to add coverage for that. Maybe even some load tests.

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: Agreed. This caused real customer pain.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Speaking of which — CS reported issues from Customer A and D.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: We should log those in the incident record in the Afflicted Customers field

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: I also saw analytics dashboards failing — this impacted more than just the web app.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s flag that in the postmortem. Our initial scope was too narrow.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: We originally thought CDN — that was a red herring. Worth calling out.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: The DB spike correlated almost exactly with deploy #341. Timeline helps nail it.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Rollback kicked off at 10:12. Full recovery was visible by 10:15.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Can someone grab the graphs and link them in the Rootly incident?

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: I’ll do that. And I’ll start a doc for the postmortem notes.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Can someone confirm if we logged this in Rootly?

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s tag the follow-up tasks as engineering actions.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: We should share a Slack update with CS and GTM teams.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s include the rollback timestamp in the write-up.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s include the rollback timestamp in the write-up.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s include the rollback timestamp in the write-up.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Can someone confirm if we logged this in Rootly?

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: Good work, everyone. This could’ve gone worse.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Can someone confirm if we logged this in Rootly?

meeting_transcript.speaker: alice
meeting_transcript.text: We should share a Slack update with CS and GTM teams.

meeting_transcript.speaker: frank
meeting_transcript.text: Can someone post screenshots of the graphs?

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: We should share a Slack update with CS and GTM teams.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s include the rollback timestamp in the write-up.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Good work, everyone. This could’ve gone worse.

meeting_transcript.speaker: dan
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s tag the follow-up tasks as engineering actions.

meeting_transcript.speaker: erin
meeting_transcript.text: Let’s tag the follow-up tasks as engineering actions.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: We should probably review alert coverage this week.

meeting_transcript.speaker: bob
meeting_transcript.text: Good work, everyone. This could’ve gone worse.

meeting_transcript.speaker: carol
meeting_transcript.text: Is anyone tracking the timeline for the RCA?
